google-bigquery:position-deletes:v2.notes: BigQuery manages Iceberg tables as a fully managed service; delete operations are handled internally via DML and exported as Iceberg V2 snapshots
caveats: BigQuery abstracts away Iceberg delete file internals; users cannot directly control position delete behavior
External engines read the exported V2 snapshots only

google-bigquery:position-deletes:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:equality-deletes:v2.notes: BigQuery manages deletes internally for BigLake Iceberg tables via DML; delete semantics are abstracted from the user
caveats: BigQuery abstracts away Iceberg delete file internals; equality delete behavior is managed internally

google-bigquery:equality-deletes:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:merge-on-read:v2.notes: BigQuery handles read strategies internally for BigLake Iceberg tables; merge-on-read vs copy-on-write is not user-configurable
caveats: Read strategy is managed by BigQuery, not user-configurable

google-bigquery:merge-on-read:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:copy-on-write:v2.notes: BigQuery uses copy-on-write for BigLake Iceberg table mutations; DML operations produce new Parquet data files

google-bigquery:copy-on-write:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Schema evolution supported: add, drop, rename columns, change data types and column modes. Some type limitations apply (BIGNUMERIC, INTERVAL, JSON, RANGE, GEOGRAPHY not supported)
caveats: BIGNUMERIC, INTERVAL, JSON, RANGE, and GEOGRAPHY data types are not supported
Schema with default value expressions not supported
Schema with field collations not supported

google-bigquery:schema-evolution:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are an Iceberg V3 feature; not applicable to V2

google-bigquery:column-default-values:v3.notes: BigQuery does not support Iceberg V3; additionally, BigLake Iceberg tables explicitly do not support schema with default value expressions
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported
Default value expressions explicitly not supported for BigLake Iceberg tables

google-bigquery:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are an Iceberg V3 feature; not applicable to V2

google-bigquery:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 nanosecond timestamps are not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Table partitioning supported for BigLake Iceberg tables (in Preview). Limited to DATE, DATETIME, and TIMESTAMP column types. BigQuery automatically scopes queries to the right partitions (hidden partitioning)
caveats: Partitioning is in Preview and requires sign-up
Only DATE, DATETIME, and TIMESTAMP partition column types are supported
Partition expiration is not supported

google-bigquery:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:partition-evolution:v2.notes: Partition evolution is explicitly not supported for BigLake Iceberg tables in BigQuery
caveats: Partition evolution is explicitly listed as unsupported in the official documentation

google-bigquery:partition-evolution:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 and partition evolution is not supported even for V2
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported
Partition evolution not supported

google-bigquery:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument transforms are an Iceberg V3 feature; not applicable to V2

google-bigquery:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:time-travel:v2.notes: Time travel supported for BigLake Iceberg tables in BigQuery for historical data access
caveats: Time travel uses BigQuery native time travel mechanism, not Iceberg snapshot-based time travel

google-bigquery:time-travel:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:table-maintenance:v2.notes: BigQuery provides fully automatic storage optimization including adaptive file sizing, automatic clustering, garbage collection, and metadata optimization. No manual maintenance required
caveats: Storage optimization is fully automatic and not user-configurable
Billed in Data Compute Units (DCUs) per second

google-bigquery:table-maintenance:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:branching-tagging:v2.notes: BigQuery does not support Iceberg branching and tagging for BigLake Iceberg tables

google-bigquery:branching-tagging:v3.notes: BigQuery does not support Iceberg branching and tagging; V3 also not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support for BigLake Iceberg tables. Iceberg V2 snapshot export with automatic refresh on each table mutation enables direct query access from open-source and third-party engines

google-bigquery:read-support:v3.notes: BigQuery only exports Iceberg V2 snapshots; V3 read support is not available
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:write-insert:v2.notes: INSERT INTO supported via GoogleSQL DML. Also supports batch loading via LOAD DATA and streaming via BigQuery Storage Write API

google-bigquery:write-insert:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:write-merge-update-delet.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE supported via GoogleSQL DML for BigLake Iceberg tables. Multi-statement transactions are available in Preview
caveats: Multi-statement transactions are in Preview and require sign-up

google-bigquery:write-merge-update-delet.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:catalog-integration:v2.notes: BigLake metastore provides unified, managed, serverless catalog integration for Iceberg tables. Supports both BigQuery native access and Iceberg REST Catalog API (GA) for interoperability with Spark, Trino, and other engines

google-bigquery:catalog-integration:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2; catalog integration is V2 only
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:hive-metastore:v2.notes: BigQuery can read external Iceberg tables registered in Hive Metastore via BigLake external tables. BigLake metastore is the recommended metastore; Hive Metastore integration is for legacy/external data
caveats: Read-only for external Hive Metastore-registered Iceberg tables
BigLake metastore is the recommended catalog for new workflows

google-bigquery:hive-metastore:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2; Hive Metastore integration is read-only and V2 only
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported

google-bigquery:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: BigQuery does not support AWS Glue Catalog

google-bigquery:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: BigQuery does not support AWS Glue Catalog

google-bigquery:rest-catalog:v2.notes: BigLake metastore supports the Iceberg REST Catalog API (GA as of November 2025). Provides interoperability with Spark, Trino, and other Iceberg-compatible engines. Supports credential vending for secure storage access delegation

google-bigquery:rest-catalog:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2; REST catalog serves V2 metadata only
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:nessie:v2.notes: BigQuery does not support Nessie catalog; BigLake metastore is the native catalog

google-bigquery:nessie:v3.notes: BigQuery does not support Nessie catalog

google-bigquery:polaris:v2.notes: BigQuery does not natively support Polaris; BigLake metastore is the native catalog

google-bigquery:polaris:v3.notes: BigQuery does not natively support Polaris

google-bigquery:unity-catalog:v2.notes: BigQuery does not support Unity Catalog; BigLake metastore is the native catalog

google-bigquery:unity-catalog:v3.notes: BigQuery does not support Unity Catalog

google-bigquery:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: BigQuery does not support Hadoop catalog; BigLake metastore is the native catalog

google-bigquery:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: BigQuery does not support Hadoop catalog

google-bigquery:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: BigQuery does not support JDBC catalog; BigLake metastore is the native catalog

google-bigquery:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: BigQuery does not support JDBC catalog

google-dataproc:position-deletes:v3.notes: Supported via Spark on Dataproc with Iceberg V3

google-dataproc:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Supported via Spark on Dataproc with Iceberg V3

google-dataproc:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Merge-on-read supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Merge-on-read supported via Spark on Dataproc with V3

google-dataproc:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Copy-on-write supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Full schema evolution via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are a V3 feature

google-dataproc:column-default-values:v3.notes: Supported via Spark on Dataproc with Iceberg V3

google-dataproc:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are a V3 feature

google-dataproc:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: Supported via Spark on Dataproc with Iceberg V3

google-dataproc:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Full hidden partitioning via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:partition-evolution:v2.notes: Partition evolution supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument transforms are a V3 feature

google-dataproc:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: Supported via Spark on Dataproc with Iceberg V3

google-dataproc:time-travel:v2.notes: Time travel via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Full table maintenance via Spark procedures on Dataproc

google-dataproc:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:write-insert:v2.notes: INSERT INTO supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:write-merge-update-delet.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Supports BigLake Metastore, Hive Metastore, and custom catalogs

google-dataproc:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Supports BigLake Metastore, Hive Metastore, and custom catalogs

google-dataproc:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Native Hive Metastore support on Dataproc

google-dataproc:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Native Hive Metastore support on Dataproc

google-dataproc:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: Can connect to AWS Glue Catalog via custom Spark configuration
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration and cross-cloud networking

google-dataproc:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: Can connect to AWS Glue Catalog via custom Spark configuration
caveats: Requires custom Spark configuration and cross-cloud networking

google-dataproc:rest-catalog:v2.notes: REST Catalog supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:rest-catalog:v3.notes: REST Catalog supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:nessie:v2.notes: Nessie catalog supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:nessie:v3.notes: Nessie catalog supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:polaris:v2.notes: Polaris supported via REST Catalog on Dataproc

google-dataproc:polaris:v3.notes: Polaris supported via REST Catalog on Dataproc

google-dataproc:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Can connect to Unity Catalog via REST Catalog API
caveats: Requires Databricks REST Catalog endpoint configuration

google-dataproc:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Can connect to Unity Catalog via REST Catalog API
caveats: Requires Databricks REST Catalog endpoint configuration

google-dataproc:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Hadoop catalog supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Hadoop catalog supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: JDBC catalog supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-dataproc:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: JDBC catalog supported via Spark on Dataproc

google-bigquery:table-creation:v2.notes: BigQuery supports creating BigLake Iceberg tables via SQL DDL (CREATE TABLE), bq CLI, and REST API. Requires Cloud resource connection and Cloud Storage bucket
caveats: Requires a Cloud resource connection with write permissions to Cloud Storage
Must specify file_format=PARQUET and table_format=ICEBERG
Table rename, copy, clone, and snapshot operations are not supported

google-bigquery:table-creation:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2 snapshot export; V3 table creation is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-dataproc:table-creation:v2.notes: Dataproc supports creating Iceberg tables via Spark DDL

google-dataproc:table-creation:v3.notes: Table creation supported via Spark on Dataproc with Iceberg V3

google-bigquery:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant type is an Iceberg V3 feature; not applicable to V2

google-bigquery:variant-type:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2; V3 variant type is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded variant is an Iceberg V3 feature; not applicable to V2

google-bigquery:shredded-variant:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2; V3 shredded variant is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry type is an Iceberg V3 feature; not applicable to V2. Note: BigLake Iceberg tables do not support GEOGRAPHY data type

google-bigquery:geometry-type:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2; V3 geometry type is not supported. GEOGRAPHY data type is also explicitly unsupported for BigLake Iceberg tables
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported
GEOGRAPHY data type not supported for BigLake Iceberg tables

google-bigquery:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector type is an Iceberg V3 feature; not applicable to V2

google-bigquery:vector-type:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2; V3 vector type is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:cdc-support:v2.notes: CDC support is an Iceberg V3 feature; not applicable to V2

google-bigquery:cdc-support:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2; V3 CDC support is not supported
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported for snapshot export

google-bigquery:lineage:v2.notes: Iceberg-level lineage is a V3 feature; not applicable to V2. Note: BigQuery provides lineage capabilities via Dataplex Universal Catalog integration

google-bigquery:lineage:v3.notes: BigQuery only supports Iceberg V2; V3 Iceberg lineage is not supported. BigQuery provides its own lineage via Dataplex Universal Catalog
caveats: Only Iceberg V2 format is supported
BigQuery-level lineage available via Dataplex, not Iceberg-native

google-dataproc:variant-type:v2.notes: Variant Type is a V3 feature

google-dataproc:variant-type:v3.notes: Variant type supported via Spark on Dataproc with Iceberg V3

google-dataproc:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded Variant is a V3 feature

google-dataproc:shredded-variant:v3.notes: Google Dataproc V3 shredded variant support is not yet documented

google-dataproc:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry Type is a V3 feature

google-dataproc:geometry-type:v3.notes: Google Dataproc V3 geometry type support is not yet documented

google-dataproc:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector Type is a V3 feature

google-dataproc:vector-type:v3.notes: Google Dataproc V3 vector type support is not yet documented

google-dataproc:cdc-support:v2.notes: Cdc Support is a V3 feature

google-dataproc:cdc-support:v3.notes: Google Dataproc V3 cdc support support is not yet documented

google-dataproc:lineage:v3.notes: Google Dataproc V3 lineage support is not yet documented
